stimulusHtml: The continuous function f is positive and has domain x > 0. If the asymptotes of the graph of f are x = 0 and y = 2, which of the following statements must be true?
choicesHtml: lim x → 0 + f ( x ) = ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4751@  and  lim x → 2 f ( x ) = ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4619@

lim x → 0 + f ( x ) = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@469C@  and  lim x → ∞ f ( x ) = 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4617@

lim x → 0 + f ( x ) = ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4751@  and  lim x → ∞ f ( x ) = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4619@

lim x → 2 f ( x ) = ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4619@  and  lim x → ∞ f ( x ) = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4619@
